gbvision.utils.finders package¶

Submodules¶

gbvision.utils.finders.circle_finder module¶

class gbvision.utils.finders.circle_finder.CircleFinder(threshold_func: Callable[[Optional[numpy.ndarray]], Optional[numpy.ndarray]], game_object, area_scalar=1.0, contour_min_area=0, contours_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, circles_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.utils.finders.object_finder.ObjectFinder

finds specific circular shaped object, and performs distance transformation

Parameters

  • threshold_func – a pipeline (or any sort of function) that returns a binary threshold of the object the finder is searching, the object needs to be white and the rest if the image black (doesn’t have to be perfect)

  • contour_min_area – the minimal area of a contour, used for FilterContours, default is 0 (no area limit)

  • contours_process – a pipeline to run on the list of contours (optional)

  • circles_process – a pipeline to run on the list of circles (optional)

find_shapes(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray]) → List[Tuple[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], Union[int, float]]][source]¶

finds all the objects and returns them in frame after full pipeline

Param

The current frame the finder searches in

Returns

A list of objects: see gbvision/constants/types

gbvision.utils.finders.contour_finder module¶

class gbvision.utils.finders.contour_finder.ContourFinder(threshold_func: Callable[[Optional[numpy.ndarray]], Optional[numpy.ndarray]], game_object, area_scalar=1.0, contour_min_area=0.0, contours_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.utils.finders.object_finder.ObjectFinder

finds any generic polygon, not recommended when another finder can be used

Parameters

  • area_scalar – optional, a scalar to multiply the area by, for fine tuning of the function’s output

  • contour_min_area – the minimal area of a contour, used for FilterContours, default is 0 (no area limit)

  • threshold_func – a pipeline (or any sort of function) that returns a binary threshold of the object the finder is searching, the object needs to be white and the rest if the image black (doesn’t have to be perfect)

  • contours_process – a pipeline to run on the list of contours (optional)

find_shapes(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray]) → List[Union[List[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]]], numpy.ndarray]][source]¶

finds all the objects and returns them in frame after full pipeline

Param

The current frame the finder searches in

Returns

A list of objects: see gbvision/constants/types

gbvision.utils.finders.convex_polygon_finder module¶

class gbvision.utils.finders.convex_polygon_finder.ConvexPolygonFinder(threshold_func: Callable[[Optional[numpy.ndarray]], Optional[numpy.ndarray]], game_object, area_scalar=1.0, contour_min_area=0.0, contours_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, convex_polygons_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.utils.finders.object_finder.ObjectFinder

finds any generic polygon, not recommended when another finder can be used

Parameters

  • area_scalar – optional, a scalar to multiply the area by, for fine tuning of the function’s output

  • contour_min_area – the minimal area of a contour, used for FilterContours, default is 0 (no area limit)

  • threshold_func – a pipeline (or any sort of function) that returns a binary threshold of the object the finder is searching, the object needs to be white and the rest if the image black (doesn’t have to be perfect)

  • contours_process – a pipeline to run on the list of contours (optional)

  • convex_polygons_process – a pipeline to run on the list of convex polygons (optional)

gbvision.utils.finders.object_finder module¶

class gbvision.utils.finders.object_finder.ObjectFinder(game_object: gbvision.utils.game_object.GameObject, area_scalar=1.0)[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

this is an abstract class that represents an object finder an object finder is a type that outputs an object’s 3d real location based on an of it image it’s GameObject real-life parameters

Parameters

  • game_object – the game object descriptor for the real-life parameters of the finder’s target

  • area_scalar – a scalar to multiply the root of the area of the shape in the image by, default is 1

abstract find_shapes(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray]) → List[Shape][source]¶

finds all the objects and returns them in frame after full pipeline

Param

The current frame the finder searches in

Returns

A list of objects: see gbvision/constants/types

locations_from_shapes(shapes: Iterable[Shape], camera: gbvision.utils.cameras.camera.Camera) → List[Union[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], numpy.ndarray]][source]¶

finds the locations of the shapes based on the shape descriptor and camera constants

Parameters

  • shapes – a list of the shapes

  • camera – the camera used to capture the frame that the shapes were found in

Returns

a list of the locations of all the shapes

gbvision.utils.finders.polygon_finder module¶

class gbvision.utils.finders.polygon_finder.PolygonFinder(threshold_func: Callable[[Optional[numpy.ndarray]], Optional[numpy.ndarray]], game_object, area_scalar=1.0, contour_min_area=0.0, contours_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, polygons_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.utils.finders.object_finder.ObjectFinder

finds any generic polygon, not recommended when another finder can be used

Parameters

  • area_scalar – optional, a scalar to multiply the area by, for fine tuning of the function’s output

  • contour_min_area – the minimal area of a contour, used for FilterContours, default is 0 (no area limit)

  • threshold_func – a pipeline (or any sort of function) that returns a binary threshold of the object the finder is searching, the object needs to be white and the rest if the image black (doesn’t have to be perfect)

  • contours_process – a pipeline to run on the list of contours (optional)

  • polygons_process – a pipeline to run on the list of polygons (optional)

find_shapes(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray]) → List[Union[List[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]]], numpy.ndarray]][source]¶

finds all the objects and returns them in frame after full pipeline

Param

The current frame the finder searches in

Returns

A list of objects: see gbvision/constants/types

gbvision.utils.finders.rect_finder module¶

class gbvision.utils.finders.rect_finder.RectFinder(threshold_func: Callable[[Optional[numpy.ndarray]], Optional[numpy.ndarray]], game_object, area_scalar=1.0, contour_min_area=0.0, contours_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, rects_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.utils.finders.object_finder.ObjectFinder

finds a rectangular shaped object

Parameters

  • area_scalar – optional, a scalar to multiply the area by, for fine tuning of the function’s output

  • contour_min_area – the minimal area of a contour, used for FilterContours, default is 0 (no area limit)

  • threshold_func – a pipeline (or any sort of function) that returns a binary threshold of the object the finder is searching, the object needs to be white and the rest if the image black (doesn’t have to be perfect)

  • contours_process – a pipeline to run on the list of contours (optional)

  • rects_process – a pipeline to run on the list of rects (optional)

find_shapes(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray]) → List[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float], Union[int, float], Union[int, float]]][source]¶

finds all the objects and returns them in frame after full pipeline

Param

The current frame the finder searches in

Returns

A list of objects: see gbvision/constants/types

gbvision.utils.finders.rotated_rect_finder module¶

class gbvision.utils.finders.rotated_rect_finder.RotatedRectFinder(threshold_func: Callable[[Optional[numpy.ndarray]], Optional[numpy.ndarray]], game_object, area_scalar=1.0, contour_min_area=0.0, contours_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>, rotated_rects_process=<gbvision.utils.pipeline.PipeLine object>)[source]¶

Bases: gbvision.utils.finders.object_finder.ObjectFinder

finds a rectangular object, but rotated. recommended to use when you know the shape isn’t parallel to the camera

Parameters

  • threshold_func – a pipeline (or any sort of function) that returns a binary threshold of the object the finder is searching, the object needs to be white and the rest if the image black (doesn’t have to be perfect)

  • area_scalar – optional, a scalar to multiply the area by, for fine tuning of the function’s output

  • contour_min_area – the minimal area of a contour, used for FilterContours, default is 0 (no area limit)

  • contours_process – a pipeline to run on the list of contours (optional)

  • rotated_rects_process – a pipeline to run on the list of rotated rects (optional)

find_shapes(frame: Optional[numpy.ndarray]) → List[Tuple[Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], Tuple[Union[int, float], Union[int, float]], float]][source]¶

finds all the objects and returns them in frame after full pipeline

Param

The current frame the finder searches in

Returns

A list of objects: see gbvision/constants/types
